In addition, a number of vessels shown under ok, phosphates, lead, &c, load outward for an Allied Government A comparison of the numbers shown under IV. for the 8 months does not therefore give an accurate criterion of the vessels in Allied service at the different periods. u 1,1 luh "Requisition" is here used to mean "requisition for full Government service." The vessels shown as "free from requisition" therefore include the vessels that are requisitioned under the special liner requisitioning scheme, under which vessels, while running for Government acoonnt are run by their owners and accept some private cargo (see page 4). !%n Incudes 25 vessels (61,801 G T.) transferred from Norwegian flag under the Norwegian Agreement. As these require to be replaced ^1 Norwegian service bj British vessels they do not represent additional vessels available for British service ' 1,600 GROSS TONNAGE AND 0V.EE ON 1918.Lakes) as to j render tliem not available for ocean-going trade or requisition.II.ANALYSIS OF VESSELS UNDER NOTICE OF REQUISITION, SHOWN UNDER II.
